intro: Amauropelta pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf shield fern, is a small, terrestrial fern native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its compact, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its rhizomes are short and produce dense clusters of leaves. The fronds are usually dark green, with a leathery texture and a distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped appearance.
